newsitem.title: USA: Pitney Bowes has higher quarter amid restructuring.
newsitem.headline: Pitney Bowes has higher quarter amid restructuring.

text.p: Pitney Bowes Inc. Thursday reported higher fourth quarter results as it restructured its Australian operations and concentrated on the mailing and facsimile markets.
Pitney Bowes makes postage meters and mailing equipment and sells copiers and facsimile machines.
It said during the fourth quarter it decided to restructure Australian operations and concentrate on the profitable mailing and high-end facsimile market.
Fourth-quarter earnings rose to $127.7 million, or 85 cents per share, from $112.6 million, or 74 cents per share, in 1995.
Revenues rose to $1.06 billion from $977.1 million.
For the full year, Pitney Bowes earned $469.4 million, or $3.12 a share, down from $583.1 million, or $3.83 a share, in 1995. Revenues rose to $3.86 billion from $3.55 billion in 1995.
Pitney Bowes stock was up 37.5 cents at $57.25 in midday trading on the New York Stock Exchange.
